availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Stuart (Meade County, Kentucky, attorney and circuit court judge)

body.p: Meade County, Kentucky, attorney and circuit court judge. Hardin County, Kentucky native. Son of Alexander L. Stuart and Jane Allen McLure Stuart. Married to Mary C. Farleigh Stuart. Father of Ellen Stuart, William A. Stuart, Charles C. Stuart, Alfred Allen Stuart, and Lettie L. Stuart. Studied law under John Allen. Admitted to the bar in 1838. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Meade County in 1848 and 1849. Attorney in Meade County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1850 and nine in 1860. Meade County Circuit Court Judge from 1856 to 1867.

bibl.p: History of Daviess County, Kentucky (Chicago, IL: Inter-state Publishing Company, 1883), p. 141-142; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, Volume II (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 599; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Kentucky District, p. 208; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Kentucky District; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, Brandenburg, p. 12; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Meade County, p. 9; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Daviess County, Owensboro, Lower Town Precinct, p. 2; Find A Grave, "Judge James Stuart (1819-1891)," Memorial #76265733, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=76265733 (accessed September 9, 2017).
